Pledgie Donations

This is the personal homepage of Elad Meidar, a web developer and an entrepreneur specializing in Ruby on Rails. I am a proud member of RailsBridge, Helping new Rails developers get into our world and also contributed a few Patches to the Ruby on Rails core.

I hang around Fort Lauderdale, FL and Tel-Aviv in Israel, and i am currently running Nautilus6 so Feel free to contact me regarding projects :).

Bag O' Links - 15/9/2009 /
name age history
Bag O' Links - 15/9/2009 15/09/2009 Another post [Elad Meidar]
  • Test::Unig 2.x slides – what’s new in the 2.x version of Test::Unit. Mike the awesome also created this gist that makes it easier to use the 2.x gem if present.
  • IE’s cookie internals – off MSDN, a few surprises for me in there.
  • Step argument support for Cucumber – EY has a lot more free time now that GitHub is far away.
  • Fix THE bug, not A bug – a struggle between a man and his code, good read.
  • Deeper into mod_rewrite – The next guide in the Netuts guide to mod_rewrite.
  • Track slow running examples in RSpec – Testing speed counts.
  • HTML tables done right – a complete overview of the HTML table structure.
  • Overcoming inferior browser hell with jQuery – solve those pesky little problems/issues when dealing with a cross browser supported interface.
  • Canonizing pseudo slugs in Rails – making to_params a bit more accurate.
  • Web based operating systems redux – soon, this is all we’ll have.
  • MacOS keyboard shortcuts – in case you have forgotten. :)
  • Popular 90s search engines – and where are they now.
  • bulletproofing @font-face- use @font-face with consideration.
  • Ruby on Rails git pre-commit hook – an example on how to utilize pre-commit hooks that could make your life easier.

GitHub treasures

  • Foreigner – Foreign keys for Rails migrations.
  • reversible-data – A simple migration-like library for doing models and tables in tests
  • coulda – Given-when-then for Test::Unit (or “If shoulda and cucumber had a baby”)
  • GitHub gem name config.github_gems replacement – This preinitializer snippet cleans up your code by slicing out the :lib option from the GitHub gem name convention. (credit: @hakunin)
  • Rake tasks for managing plugins as submodules – again credit goes to @hakunin
  • Conjure – a Rails-like framework for Clojure….good luck doing that :).
  • regexp_crawler – crawl the web with this regexp driven gem.
